intro: Metalonicera edulis, commonly known as the edible moonflower, is a flowering plant native to certain tropical regions. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a sweet fragrance. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, while the stems are succulent and often covered in fine hairs.
